I personally, hands down, find this to be one of the greatest WWII games there is, although tanks and warships aren't out, however, I'll give some reasons to my decision  -Free, first of all. No reason not to try it out. -Historic (At times), if your a history guy/girl, you like some parts in War Thunder -Graphics, I personally think they are great, the game looks beautiful -Realism, Ability to have fuel leaks, disabled flaps and unconcious crew members makes combat unique and (sometimes) a challenge -Numerous planes and plane unlocks, they keep the game going so your always working up for a new fighter, fresh machine guns or a 500 lb bomb -A bunch of different types of planes, so you can be a strategic heavy bomber, a sneaky floating plane or a vicious fighter plane -New features coming soon! (Side note), currently, we only have planes, however, in the near future, there will be tanks, and warships, meaning you can fight with feet wet or on dry land -Extra fun with friends (Side note), if you have some friends, invite them and make a squadron of fighters or a grouping of bombers  I hope this review helps you, and if this won the war for your Megabites on your hard-drive for War Thunder, I hope to win a war with you, be it in the air, or (later) on the ground or in the waters.  Good hunting, have a nice day, and I hope to see you on the horizon.

Awsome air and tank battle simulator - with many game modes, and realistic damage models, great both for casual and demanding players alike.   The game features physics, graphics and damage models far superior to the World of Whatever series, not to mention that (usually) the community is far less toxic, especially in realistic battles (although you are always bound to find an exeption from time to time).   For me, the major downside is very slow research of last tier vehicles (that is unless you have premium accaunt) and sometimes unfair matchmaking, when you get spawned into a battle with vehicles 10 years older than everyone elses.  Still, I strongly recommend this game to everyone intersted in combat sims and WW2.

Having shifted from World of Tanks to this, there's a few obvious comparisons to be made. War Thunder has better graphics, which you can even see from the trailers, and is well optimised for varying machines. War Thunder's damage models, whilst initially confusing ('but I'm sure I hit them, shouldn't they be dead?'), makes kills hugely satisfying, as well as increases a skill ceiling that in WOT felt capped by the huge simplifications Wargaming made.  Pros: - Tanks (and sensible ones) - no starting with terrible pre-war crap in this game, you are straight into the Panzers. - Tiering System - seems far less arbitrary and random than equivalent games - There's Planes. As a tank fanatic, I was sceptical, but the air battles are actually hilarious fun, mostly because everyone is pretty bad, leading to aerial nonsense. - Good Damage Models - Modules and weak spots make blowing tanks up satisfying - Relative Realism - at least compared to other comparable games. Ammunition types abound. - Vehicle continuity. Comparison: War Thunder has five different versions of the Panzer IV tank, and modifications to each have only small effects. World of Tanks decided to lump the Panzer IV into three versions, in which you have to grind to unlock new equipment for each, which radically change the tank's performance. War Thunder thus allows new players in a tank to not be hugely overwhelmed when they fight their first battle in a particular tank or plane. - Less grinding/more sensible unlock system - While still in linear trees, War Thunder's vehicles can be unlocked by XP gained in any other battle, meaning you don't have to grind in a tank you don't like to reach one you do. It also feels like progression is more swift in this game. - Less P2W - Other games of a similar type often tend to hide specific vehicles (usually more powerful or unbalanced ones) behind pay walls. I have yet to encounter this, and I certainly haven't felt like premium vehicles are better than standard ones. - Tanks can Drift - No explanation really needed. If you want to slide 20 tons of steel sideways round a corner and try a no-scope, you do it. It probably won't work, but it will look awesome. - Maps are big - Another comparison to World of Tanks. WOT forces you down narrow alleys and specific kill-zones to guarantee combat. War Thunder does not, instead providing varied terrain, and satisfying across-map shots can occur.  Cons: - Some matchmaking seems ridiculous. Tier 1 German tanks cannot fight T-34s at all, yet can end up in the same matches. Really, War Thunder's tier structure should be more rigid, and keep to single tier games. - Russian stuff seems a little more powerful than it should. Particularly planes, which seem to have miniguns instead of machine guns, which never jam to boot. - The Community isn't poisonous, but it certainly isn't going to help you in game. For a team-based game, expect an astounding lack of cohesion. - Artillery in ground battles. Some vehicles can call it in, and its not very well balanced, because some matches degenerate into camping with artillery. - Some Tank matches also degenerate into spawn-camping. Particularly those with more open spawns, or single spawn points. The aforementioned artillery can also target these areas.  Despite it's flaws, War Thunder has thus far proven very entertaining. There's a nice blend of realism and gaming, with a satisfyingly high skill ceiling. It takes a while to get your head round it, and it is sometimes rage-inducing, like any other game, but I have not regretted transitioning to this game at all.  8/10 - Fun and well-designed, needs more polish.

You can fly a plane, and soon, there will be naval fleets and land vehicles to use. It has really in-depth mechanics that pertain to real-life, but also have some stuff that are in the game to make it fun.  It's a free-to-play game, and it runs GREAT. You don't need a good PC to run this above 60 fps, you can probably use an office computer to play this and get 40+ fps on min.  You can pick from various countries that were in World War 2. Japan, Germany, United States, UK, and Russia.  It's based on multiplayer, but there are some single player missions and some that you can play with your friends, and there's also a mission editor.  A lot of things can happen in this game, like, your wing being shot off, or your pilot being knocked out. You can even do a 'soft landing' and get XP for that in case you get shot down.  You can play with friends and invite them to your group, or 'squad' and you and your wingman can play in various things. You can even make a squadron eventually, but that costs a bit.  Also, the soundtrack is pretty good, it's a reminder of those WW2 air combat movies.  Also, since it's a free-to-play, there's no risk in trying.  If you've ever wanted a WW2 plane sim mixed with modern multiplayer elements, just download it.

now i recently hit 220hrs on this game and i still dont feel like im ready to review it but here goes.  This game is great. Gaijin have done all the right moves w/ this game, until recently. The matchmaking got so bad that i took a 7 month hiatus b/c it was just so broken, when i returned however i had one of the most fun experiences i've had while playing.  Now lets get into the actual review:  I'm going to start w/ just some pros and cons, then move on to gameplay, followed up by graphics, and finally sum up the main points and say my personal opinion w/ some facts.  Pros: > Lots of WWII - Vietnam war era vehicles >Accurate Damage Models and Rounds ( rarely) >Nice graphics >4 gamemodes and lots of maps >Good realistic Aviation and Tank sim ( I'd recommend DCS or IL-2 Stumorvik for flyers)  Cons: >Broken Battle Rating (I'll get to that later) >Russian Bias (Again I'll get to it later) >Paywalls for some game changing items (I'll get to it later) >Lots of grinding (For some this might be a pro)  Gameplay:  Now War Thunder's gameplay is... unique. Sometimes you'll end up with a perfect match e.g Tigers, T-34 / IS's and / or M4 Shermans but other times you get a match which pit's Tiger II's against Matilda II's.  Now the battle rating system is quite clever it keeps certain era tanks / planes from fighting higher / lower era tanks / planes, but it has gone to crap these past few months e.g BR 5 vehicles going up against BR 6-6.7 vehicles.  Ahh... Russian Bias  Graphics:  Now the graphics in this game are stunning, presuming you are running everything on max and have a beefy computer. There is however a small, tiny, miniscule flaw, if you play on the lowest graphics it COMPLETELY REMOVES FOILAGE! Meaning that players who might not have the best PC have a distinct advantage but, of cause, there are the people who use it so they can have a easy view on whats happening behind that bush.  Main Points:  - This game is terrible for it's matchmaking - The graphics on a high end PC are great - There are small bugs w/ the graphic system - It is only for people who love grinding  Conclusion: I would recommend this game to people who don't mind spending 700+ hrs grinding, overlook the bad matchmaking, and WW2 enthusiasts  i give this game a ♥♥♥♥ blyad / idi nahui  7/10

Yeah, I hate this game. Not because of Russian and British bias, although it is kinda there, but for the obvious money-grabbing  Higher tiers make you lose money: In the lower tiers, tanks are easy to replace and destroying an enemy tank rewards you around 1000 lions, so you only have to destroy one or two tanks to cover the repair cost of your tank. But this changes once you get to around tier 3. For instance, a German Tiger H1 requires a whopping 4600 lions to repair, and killing an enemy tank is still only worth around 1000. That means to just simply COVER the repair cost of losing a Tiger, you have to destroy FIVE enemy tanks. And that's not even to make a profit, that's to get your Tiger back at the end of this ♥♥♥♥ stained road.  Premium tanks: What a suprise, an MMO where you can spend money to be better than other people. Pay us a large sum of real money and we'l give you a Calliope American rocket tank, filled with 30-something rockets that can be fired without reloading and can pen basically any armor of your BR. Have fun.  BR squishing: Recent updates have made it so tanks of absurdly high BR are now fighting lower tanks. So now light tanks with a battlerank of 2.3 are now duking it out with tanks having a battle rank of 4.7. You tell me who probobly wins.  Planes are dead: This is really, really sad. The game started with a really engenious system to planes and air battles and still remains decent. But recently, as War Thunder added tank combat, they left behind the GOOD part of WT with air battles and now make ♥♥♥♥♥♥, poorly made and obviously bias tank games. A waiting list for a tank battle will be around a few hundred people. For an air battle, it's around eleven.  Saddest part: These flaws are litterally the only reason people keep playing, because of BR squishing and the loss of the mighty plane, most players with high BRs are all too happy to go fight a bunch of players who have just started the game. In short, making the entire thing like the gaming version of a pyramid scheme. Those who played the game first get all the benefits, those who are just starting get slaughtered and then leave the game like I did.  If you're a masochist, have fun. Make sure to pick Russian tanks and British planes, they're the only ones worth playing.

War Thunder is a WWII airplane game. At first I didn't care much of the game. All you had to do was point your mouse at an enemy and you're already a professional. It was lacking skill which did not bring any memorial experience that was important.   Then I bought a joystick so I can play the upcoming game, Star Citizen. I went back to this game so I could practice with it. I suck with this joystick. It has to be 75% harder than using a mouse. It's frustrating when I have such a hard time while other players with a mouse are casually shooting me down.   However, since it is very difficult, once you finally shoot down a player, it brings one hell of a statisfaction. When you struggle so hard to play the game and you finally kill someone, my god, it brings an amazing feeling. This is the Dark Souls of aviation. Also, the opening song is absolutely amazing. It's constantly in my head. I feel like a champion while I'm playing this game. It's truely an exciting game to be playing. So if you've been playing this game with a mouse, I seriously recommend you buy a joystick. It will become difficult, but the gameplay expirence will blow your pants off.

Lets start with talking how gorgeous the game looks, if you are a fan of nice looking games, you won't feel left out. The sky, planes and mountains look very nice. Just dont fly close to the houses, they are sometimes overlapping and just a mess. But don't worry, if you don't have the best pc, you can change the quality. For people who can't afford to buy ingame money with your real cash, stay calm, because so far I have not wasted any of my real money and I am often the best in my team. You have the option to fly a bomber if you want to erase the enemy base, I prefere fighters. You can also pick between the 5 countries: British(my favorite), Japan(fast, but the damage is as good as throwing rocks at them) German, Russia and US. But at the end of the day, if you pick any country its a win win situation. I am makeing it sound like you can only choose 1, no you can play with all of them. The costumisation on planes is nice, but you cant use very many different ''stickers'', you can always buy the stickers, but that will cost real money. (you can still costumise and make your plane unique). If you are new to the game, then don't worry, they teach you how to fly the plane very well in the tutorials. Also, there are many youtubers with helpful information. The game has tanks, I tried that, but didn't really enjoy it. Just the planes is good for me. Overall the game looks pretty and plane gameplay is the best I know of. The game is free (a true bargain), try it.

This game started off really fun but as it's progressed it's gone from fun to frustrating to outright crap. I've only played air battles because that's what i was looking for. The controls are a bit sluggish and the planes don't respond as they would IRL but it's a game, what do you expect? That aside- they treat these planes as if they're made of bubble gum and spit. A single burst from some planes will rip a wing off .. which only happened to the Zeros due to their lack of armor. Another plane you get in and the tail gets shot off by a single burst. Long story short, the game seems to have no tier seperation, if it does it needs to be tightened. A bi-plane vs a P-51 is a crap match up. The damage rates are stupid and not relistic at all. American planes were high in armor and could take several hits withut issue. A piolt getting knocked out in a plane with two piolts shouldn't cause you to crash. The loading screen tells about how a plane can fly with 1/2 a wing..but when you end up with 1/2 a wing and can still control it the game will boot you out automaticly after 10 seconds so what good is the knowledge? I've almost landed and repaired a damaged plane several times if the damn game would let me.

After two weeks of play I have called it quits. Started out pretty good to tell you the truth but the more you get into it, the more you start to understand the game the more you see the flaws. Without spending any money I quickly got tier2 planes. tier 3 is where it starts to truly grind. With constant 60fps and 37 ping palnes keep disappearing, reappearing, like playing with ghosts. Hit detection? keep getting sound that I am hitting the plane but no hits registered. What you are playing on your screen and what is actually happening in game are two diiferent realities. Play a few matches and then watch the replays and you will see the difference.  Going to the forums for help? Good luck!! I have never seen so many posts locked by Mods in any forum.

Warthunder, more like Grind-thunder, this game IS the definition of grind, ever played MMO's before? well this makes them look like a freaking casual game, grind wise. Hoping to get jets like phlydaily or baronvongamez? Lol, no, its impossible. Even if you do try to, the ludicrous amounts of research needed for one jet (almost 300K Research) is insane. Pair this ludicrous amount of research with the extremely low RP per match (around 1.5K RP, and thats if you are in first place with pretty much ALL the kills.). i did some math, yes, math, and it would take at that rate (assuming you DID get that much per match EVERY match) it would take aroudn 600 matches of arcade mode, YES 600 hundred. thats for one jet. one. Not to mention that there is SO much grind that even if you did manage to pull yourself together and grind through all 600 matches, its more like 1-2,000 because most matches you really only get around 500-700 RP. ALSO, dont exectt gaijin 'entertainment' to fix these problems , because they aren't, I have played in a TIER ONE biplane (germans) not to mention a reserve biplane, and saw an AIROCOBRA (last bit of T2, borderline T3) fighter plane destroying EVERYBODY. Why you ask am i being matched with an almost T3 plane? Only God knows, but oh, maybe, its their $h177y matchmaking system ( aka BR) meaning that if your a reserve plane (1 BR) you can get matched with a 2 BR plane, (T2) this is so incredibly stupid. This paired with russian and british bias, more on that in a sec, combines to make a incredibly unfair , and not fun experience. The russians and British planes (russian tanks later) Are SO over powered that is makes all other planes look like snails with peashooters, for example, the russian 'ishak' AKA turn faster than you and shoot you with KV2 shells, plane. This plane is so stupidly unbalanced that a few of them, yes a few, there are more than one, can turn basically faster than a biplane, and pack an insane weapon payload all of which are capable of one shotting/obliterating your plane. Oh and dont even get me STARTED on the spitfires, oh wait, i am, the spitfires are probably one of those planes that you see, and run away going NOPE NOPE NOPE NOPE, because, the spitfires pack around 6+ machine guns of around 12mm calibur, and turn at around a biplane status (they also go into up to T3-4, meaning that your king cobra, (slow turn time) WILL get rekt by these spitfires, because they can quite literally turn circles around you) Note that the british tree basically consists of spitfires, and the only british planes you will EVER see in a match are spitfires, and wellingtons. Take note of this though, i will continue playing this game ONLY because there is no other game with this timeline with planes/tanks (no world of tanks for me) . I will never play realistic/sim battles JUST for the fact that they take around 30 minutes to an hour to finish (no joke) and there are NO bonus research / money in this game mode , take that into consideration when in arcade you can basically make 4 times the research in about a fifth of the time, HOWEVER im not saying that by any means you can make large amounts of RP 'fast' in this game. no no, you will waste away your life trying to grind away the tiers to get that one jetplane that you want, at the time of writing, ive spent 150 hours of my life on this terribly unbalanced game. All in all though, i cannot recommend this game for people who just want a quick bit of fun before you would go do something else (double action boogaloo is much better suited for this, and is actually FUN).
it is awesome and everyone shoud get it

Let me say that while this says I have only 20-something hours on record, I've been playing it for months and months before it came to steam.  First of all, I've invested hundreds into this game. DO NOT DO THIS. I bought the bloody eagles to convert to experience for my flight crews. Leveling them up creates no visible advantage over another player. You're essentially wasting your eagles. Buying the upgrades creates no visible advantage, with the exception of more guns, different ammunition and more bombs. Since the 1.37 patch, not only is your eagle now less valuable than a peso, you get far less return from them, which is more like a great big 'PlSS OFF' from Gaijin.  The new leveling system is the exact opposite from what they promised. Instead of making leveling up easier, they've placed all the aircraft into 5 tiers now, and you must now research each plane individually, instead of just having access to purchase the planes you level into. But don't fret: After you research the planes and parts, you still have to buy them. This has slown the previously percieved grind into the equivalent of pusing a car uphill. While in park. And with all flat tires. With six Ralphie May's sitting in it. And three dead bodies in the trunk.  COMMUNICATION. This is key to maintaining teamwork and winning any engagement. However, when you are in the middle of a dogfight, this is impossible, as they have STILL NOT IMPLIMENTED any form of voice communication. Typing in the middle of a dogfight equals death. Hence the term 'typekill'.  PLANES. Gorgeous planes. Beautiful selection(When you finally unlock one). However, most of the battles boil down to who has the most bombers. Not really much balance in that aspect.  This game is like a beautiful woman: No matter how pretty she is, someone somewhere is tired of her ♥♥♥♥.   Final Straw: After engaging in a conversation in the game's chat rooms with others, expressing our disdain for how abyssmal the grind and lack of true dogfighting this game contains, and how this game feels more like a chore now than an actual form of entertainment, I have been banned from chat for the offense of, and I'm quoting, 'Insulting the developers.'   UPDATE: So at the beckoning of a few fellow gamers, I reinstalled the game to test out the much anticipated tanks. Someone had mentioned in reviews that the simulator battles in the flying part of the game were broken, because they would go on for long periods at a time, and would almost exclusively be Germany vs Russia. Well, the only tanks available are from either Germany or Russia. Tested the tanks. The T50 is by far the most overpowered tank in Tier I vehicles. Almost completely covered in 40MM armor, there are only a few tanks that can actually penetrate the armor, let along damage the tank. The T50 belongs in Tier II at the earliest in the game, and if you find yourself in a match against three of them, consider the match lost. Don't get me started on that goddam ZIS - 30. Three DIRECT hits on one of the most lightly armored vehicles in the game, and it still won't die. Can't say I should really be surprised, that Russian tanks in a game run by Russian developers would be so strong.

With all of War Thunders ups and downs. The core of the game is a spectacular experience in which you take control of iconic WWI-WWII aircraft and battle high in the skys for air dominance and soon to be on the ground with your tanks, and in the ocean with your warships. The game is not P2W no matter what anyone says. Any plane can kill any plane. An BF 109 can kill a Sabre or a Biplane can kill a Me 262. You spend money and get premium planes, great. I can still kill you though. 1.37 changed a lot of things, but the core is still there. The BR system is not great, but still works and is changing all the time as they gather data. It is no flight simulator, there is a mode for it, but it is not to the extent IL2 is. The game is great and I recommend. I downloaded this game directly from their site months before it was released here. I have to say that I am pleased with the rate it is being developed. Bug fixes and features are released at a decent pace. The game looks beautiful. Plays smooth on my very modest system.  The pay store is very reasonable. Pricing well below what you might find in other Free-to-Play games. Nothing in it is really 'pay to win'. The usual cosmetic stuff and some boosts to help you level faster. It really is dirt cheap for boosts, though.  The game itself is very fun. While the main mode is arcade there is a harder historic battles mode and full realism simulation mode. These modes are very populated.... getting into games is quick. (Especially if you choose to play on any region. Lag issues seem to not matter much at all.)  At the moment there is a very good selection of planes to fly covering a wide variety of playstyles. Bombers, fighters, dive-bombers, and so on. Damage modelling is very neat and immersive. Flight model in arcade is fun and easy to adjust too. Realism model is challenging for anyone who would enjoy a sim of this sort.  The game is fun. I think anyone looking to shoot planes could easily jump into this game and find themselves going back to it again and again. I know I do.  A+ would recommend.

I was just a kid, I hopped into a plane, fighting for my brethern back home, my family, our country. I thought I was extremely skilled since I shot down multiple enemy aircrafts while bombing multiple ground targets simulatenously. However, as maneuverable as my plane was, I was shot down by a far superior winged beast that had jet engines, my old ww1 plane was no match.   As I tumbled into the ground, I pulled my chutes. I landed on the ground, found a tank and drove around. Looking for enemies to shoot down but as an experienced pilot my skills had not translated into tanks and I was unable to control it, the tank was blown to peices. Unable to breathe, I blacked out.   I awoke in a hospital where the doctors looked at me, then at each other nodding their heads with disapproval. Many many years had gone by and I was unaware of how many battles I had been in and survived. I had won the lottery each time! Every near death experiences honed my skills, drove my ego, made me into a battle hardened veteran of the skies. I was invicible, until one day. I was flying around in my newly aquired jet engine plane and saw a poor fellow in a slow ww1 plane. I saw a reflection of myself, in my youth as I used to mindlessly rush the enemies and had no tactics or arieal maneuvers.   I hesitated for a brief moment, but realized this was an endless cycle of life and death. Mercilessly, I destroyed his slow and flimsy aircraft and put a huge distance between us. As he was plummeting to the ground and I was soaring across the skies, our eyes met for a breif moment, I saw the rage, the fraustration and the look of defeat in his eyes. I knew he wasn't gonna die. I knew at the back of my head, he would get his revenge one day.   Then I got rammed by another plane.   10/10 would get rammed again.

Well................... I have spent to long on this damn game. Ive been playing it since early on and way before it existed on steam. I have spent around $300 on this game over a few years. I regret nothing. It is the best free to play game i can think of. Grindinf used to be easier pre 1.31 if i can recall but it is still easy to grind and you get free daily XP boosters that can boost you up to 500%. If you fork over about $20 you can get a high tier premium with a limited premium account and all you need to do is get one kill in an RB battle and you will easily make 11000 XP points. But the cool thing is you can go without spending money and still grind effectivly. The best part of this game is the historical acrruacy and the great detail in flight models, weapons, and damage models. Note tanks are not arcady and if you are looking for a really simple type of tank game go over and spend time at War Games World of Tanks. But if you want a beautiful looking game with amazing gameplay and intense tactical tank and aircraft combat you have come to the Right place.  Do not be scared to give War Thunder money, the updates are amazing and are worth supporting the devs. But if you cant afford it.... dont be worried its still easy to grind and there are often free events with easy tasks to unlock premium planes or even you get 'battle trpheys' which can give you discounts or even perminant 100% XP boosters (tailsmen) that are bound to a certain random aircraft in the country you are using.   good luck and have fun hope this review helped any one on the edge of wondering if they want to play this great game.

This game is great! If you want to fly planes OR drive Tanks this is the game for you! People cry about Bias and stuff but thats just like calling anyone better then you a cheater, it's just sad salty QQ... I only fly planes, but I tried Tanks and it was fine. I've made it to several Jets in American tree, and am almost to Jets in Germany and British. I've had plenty of fun and as I learned my planes strengths, even the planes people call bad serve me well. Later I bought some premium bundles for really cool planes like the BF 109 G-2, and the A6M5-Ko Reisn that also came with a whole two weeks premium time AND golden eagles that I saved for MORE premium time. Well, I bought the British Mustang Mk.1 because that Mustang is just a boss, the ONLY Mustang with Cannons and it kicks ♥♥♥!   Bottom line here is pick it up, have fun, fly your plane the way it's supposed to be flown don't try to turn fight everything after Tier 1 unless you pick a turn fighter nation like Russia or Japan. And you will progress well with the free premium and early eagles, spend it all on premium time. After that, if you like the game and want to keep moving along quickly, drop 20-60$ on it, and you can easily get to the bottom of any nation you choose to focus on. As an Ace Combat fan from the old Playstation days, I'm ashamed it took me so long to pick this up. I always looked it over like meh, World of Warplanes. But it's not that at all, it blows War Gaming away!

War Thunder is a great free-to-play World War II era flight arcade or simulator game. It's your preference that makes the game for you. Someone looking to have fun flying planes around with friends or an avid flight enthusiast looking for a realistic level of detail from managing airspeed to keep from stalling and responsive joystick controls. I have a Logitech Attack 3 joystick and its buttons were not recognized by the game on startup so I had to reassign all of the bindings, but that was the only problem that I encountered so far. I seriously recommend this game to anyone who has an interest for historical aircraft, and its free-to-play, so why not?

I have to say that while i sometimes enjoyed the dogfights there are some issues that make this game unplayable for me:  1. utterly long pauses  when getting shot you have to travel back to base in order to repair, something that usually takes as long as the match itself, so there really is no point in doing so and throwing yourself into enemy fire is much more effective.  Sometimes when respawning the action is so far away, that you have t travel several minutes  2. controls There are a lot of different control modes in this game, and while it sounds great it's actually the problem. Playing with mouse-aim is so ridiculously easy compared to gamepad or keyboard that doing the letter just gets you shot down.  But mouse-aiming doesn't feel at all like flighing a plane because of the lacking difficulty and is just plain boring. The only game mode that prohibits mouse-aim is the simulator mode and seamed to be way too complicated.  3. untransparant leveling I am not an expert in aviation, i just wanted to have some fun flighing a fighter. but then there are so many different planes to lvl with no explanation but a LOT of numbers that don't mean ♥♥♥♥ to me although i am an aerospace engineering-student.  4. matchmaking I haven't played too much but it seemes to be a known issue. One game feels quite great and leveled, the next is like shooting fish in a barrel. But then i get thrown in a game and before I'm even in range i get shot down with 2 hits (usually takes about 10-15) and the enemys are unbelievably manouverable.   So NO, too many issues

Fans of the Il2 Series and other popular WW2 combat flight sim games will need to check out this title. The level of graphical detail and attention to small things make this game visually amazing. Gaijin overall puts considerable effort in affording historical accuracy more or less to most of the game and does alot of justice to much of the content. Minor bugs or inconsistancies in menu's or squads is to be found wanting and some balence concerns among the differing nation's vehicles do exist. The new ground forces mode is really sharp and the graphics engine plus great sound effects and noise of war give the battlefield a new and sharp distintive view that no other game has yet to approach in this genre.   Overall this game is very fun and anyone even considering it should give it a go to see if it's for you. War Thunder offers a giant selection of planes and a modest start to ground forces availible for minimal effort to hop in and enjoy something cool. The real expection, personally above aircraft, will be the upcoming naval portion as there will be rediculous possibility on how Gaijin will execute this and how the balencing and damage model is implemented on a sharper scale than currently present with ships as-is. Hopefully the test for that will begin soon :D Fly Safe!

My review of this game is focused on the tanks; I've only played a handful of aircraft matches. And I have to say that in a superficial comparison between WT and World of Tanks, this game definitely comes out on top. There's more dedication to gameplay and detail, the damage mechanics are superior and the potential for individual input in a match is much greater. In WoT you play tier 6 and get into tier 8 matches ten games in a row, GG. WT never takes it's unfairness to this level and overall seems much less determined to crush and destroy it's players.  That said, the game is still trying to destroy you. The gameplay and business model has something fundamentally bullying and wrong about it. I can't play either game for more than ten minutes without raging.  The adagium 'All companies exist to make money, but you don't have to be a ♥♥♥♥ about it' springs to mind. It's not that I mind bullying generally. In PVP for Dark Souls or EVE online there are endless bullies; it's practically the reason people play. But even the maxed out bullies get taken down every now and then, the mechanics and psychology of the game lend themselves to that. There is no such comeuppance in WT, taking down a bully is nothing special.  Gajin crafts an illusion of significance, as is standard for any F2P experience. The mystery box is empty, you're not supposed to 'finish' the game and there is no reward for doing so. You only get rewards for logging in daily and playing one more match. They made their machine and it's working perfectly. They don't even care to cheat. By definition a cheater is still playing the game with you, they're still interacting with you in a meaningful way. Gajin allows for no such interaction. Pay gold or don't, git gud or don't, what's it to them?

Excellent Game, the grind is very monotonous I'd admit... to get interesting planes takes a long time since many planes fill similar roles to one another until they become more specialized or have different flight characteristics.  There's literally no such thing as Russian Bias... people simply fight Yak's are low altitude in the Yak's home territory, the Yak was a fighter designed for fighting in low altitude as a ground attack and close air support fighter. It has a good climb rate due to its small size and powerful engine but turns like junk at high altitude. People just complain for nothing.   The only people who complain about Russian Bias are Ignorant, untrained, unlucky or like to blame something for their demise from a better pilot.   But if you can learn to lift yourself from complaining that the game is unbalanced its likely to be a lot of fun for you.
